question: Consider the following statements:
Statement(I): The set of all solutions of the linear inequalities <katex>$3x+8<17$</katex> and <katex>$2x+8 \ge 12$</katex> are <katex>$x<3$</katex> and <katex>$x \ge 2$</katex> respectively.
Statement(II): The common set of solutions of linear inequalities <katex>$3x+8<17$</katex> and <katex>$2x+8 \ge 12$</katex> is (2, 3)
Which of the following is true?
choices: Statement (I) is true but statement (II) is false
Statement (I) is false but statement (II) is true
explanation: Inequality 2: <katex>$2x \ge 4 \Rightarrow x \ge 2$</katex>. Statement I is true.
Common solution is <katex>$2 \le x < 3$</katex>, written as [2, 3). The statement says (2, 3), which excludes 2. Statement II is false.
